data.title: Android nextcloud app - how to put data-directory on sdcard1?
data.meta_description: I'm using a smartphone aquaris E4.5 with android Lollipop 5.0 and the android app does not show me my sdcard1. It's a samsung 16gb sdcard , I formatted as FAT32, I ahve tried NTFS, I added a name to the Disk Label.  I ha…
data.text:
I’m using a smartphone aquaris E4.5 with android Lollipop 5.0 and the android app does not show me my sdcard1. It’s a samsung 16gb sdcard , I formatted as FAT32, I ahve tried NTFS, I added a name to the Disk Label.

I have tried also a 8gb sdcard, anyway always both android nextcloud app ,stable and latest dev, both can’t access my sdcard , my nextcloud app “settings” simply do not show my sdcard as an option. It just show /storage/emulated/0 , and I can choose only that.

I have a VM with nextcloud 11.0.3.

any help ?? anything I can try??

bq aquaris E4.5 with android lollipop 5.0, I can only choose sdcard1 as default from android “setting>storage”, then a /DCIM/ and a /LOST.DIR directory is created in sdcard.

“nextcloud istant upload pictures” works both from internal storage or sdcard( if I choose in “settings>storage” to use the sdcard as default)

bq aquaris E4.5 with android lollipop 5.0, I can only choose sdcard1 as

default from android “setting>storage”, then a /DCIM/ and a /LOST.DIR

directory is created in sdcard.

“nextcloud istant upload pictures” works both from internal storage or

sdcard( if I choose in “settings>storage” to use the sdcard as default)

I’m not ready yet, I do not ahve another phone in case things will go

wrong, so I yet hope to fix that someway from Lollipop 5.0
